page.title: 11STANDEAN FARM
page.content: Standean is a large farm on the Downs. On it there are about 1OOO sheep and 8O beef cattle. Crops grown on this 94O acre farm are wheat, barley, oats, turnips, swede and corn. Two crawler tractors, 1 four wheel drive tractor, 2 small tractos and 1 combine harvester are the main machines used. There are 3 people working on the farm. Diseases that occur on the farm are fungi on corn and insects, maggots, lice and sheep's scab on sheep. The corn gets sprayed for weeds and the animals are dipped in preventative medicine. The farmer, a tenant, has been farming for about 43 years. He has a turnover of Â£2OO,OOO per annum. Major problems are the large flints and the cost of tractor tyres at Â£14OO a set. The EEC also affects him as there is no milk production now. Wild life is preserved
